intro: Hibbertia hastata, commonly known as the golden wattle, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the Dilleniaceae family and is characterized by its bright yellow flowers that bloom in spring. The plant typically grows as a shrub, reaching heights of up to 1.5 meters, with lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Hibbertia hastata is well adapted to various soil types and is often found in open forests and woodlands. Its striking appearance makes it a popular choice for garden cultivation.
